definition: line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: He said, "Happily unemployed." And then he said, "So, Brooke!
sentences.chinese: 他說，是呀，我很慶幸我是無業遊民。

sentences.english: From now on, I became a hobo.
sentences.chinese: 從今往後，我成了無業遊民。

sentences.english: Hobo Chen Quan is abjection because of business failure.
sentences.chinese: 無業遊民陳全因生意失敗而落魄。
她繼續說，這麼說你是無業遊民。

sentences.english: "Hoboes" regularly knocked on their door asking for a little food.
sentences.chinese: 無業遊民經常敲他們家的門討點兒喫的。

sentences.english: Arnold was an elderly hobo whose life was simple and uncomplicated.
sentences.chinese: 阿諾是生活是簡單而不復雜的一個年老的無業遊民。
他們是無業遊民中的聖戰者。

definition: lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
to make a long story short (idiom)
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
